class_notes: Synchronous class attendance required.  Asynchronous assessments.  Technology required:  webcam, microphone, and ability to scan written work.  Synchronous and asynchronous components required; synchronous components recorded. No timed assessments. The 4th credit hour for this course is designated for a "virtual" experiential learning component. Technology/access needs for this component: ability to access and navigate Digication ePortfolio platform (required); ability to access and navigate websites in the U.S., Japan, and elsewhere (including virtual exhibits, web magazines, blogs, etc.), film viewing platforms available through our library, YouTube and FlipGrid (alternatives provided where access is restricted). Please contact professor for more details.
course_description: History of the use of visual images in Western culture. Study of tools necessary to read images, including still and moving images, performance, and display.
prerequisites: ENG_OX 185 or ENG_OX 186 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 4368, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: OXF, Meets: MW 9:40-10:55a, Instructor: M. Adams, Status: Open
